greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: A hybrid of Kolakoski's sequence A000002 and Golomb's sequence A001462: if A001462(n) is odd replace it with 1, if even with 2.
comment: This is A000002 rewritten so the run lengths are given by A001462.
The companion sequence, A001462 rewritten so the run lengths are given by A000002, seems to be A156253.

Note that Kolakoski's sequence A000002 and Golomb's sequence A001462 have very similar definitions, although the asymptotic behavior of A001462 is well-understood, while that of A000002 is a mystery. The asymptotic behavior of the two hybrids A156253 and A321020 might be worth investigating.
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..25000

N. J. A. Sloane, Coordination Sequences, Planing Numbers, and Other Recent Sequences (II), Experimental Mathematics Seminar, Rutgers University, Jan 31 2019, Part I, Part 2, Slides. (Mentions this sequence)
program: (PARI) a = vector(84, k, k); for (i=1, oo, for (j=1, a[i], a[n++] = i; print1 (2-(i%2) ", "); if (n==#a, break(2)))) \\ _Rémy Sigrist_, Nov 12 2018
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 11 2018
